member.name: T:Libplanet.Net.AppProtocolVersion
member.summary:
A claim of a version.
Every peer in network shows others their information. As every peer can change its software by itself, this is theoretically arbitrary, hence a “claim.” (i.e., no authority).
In order to verify who claimed a version, every has its which is made by its . method purposes to determine whether an information is claimed by its corresponding in fact.

member.name: T:Libplanet.Net.Consensus.Context`1
member.summary:
A state machine class of PBFT consensus algorithm. The state machine is responsible for proposing, validating, voting a block and committing the voted block to the blockchain. There are five states:
which is the initial state when the is not called (i.e., round has not been started).
, which is the state when the round has been started and waiting for the block proposal. If a validator is a proposer of the round, it will propose a block to the other validators and to itself.
, which is the state when a block proposal for a round has been received. While translating to this step, state machine votes for the block whether block is valid or not, and waiting for any +2/3 votes from other validators.
, which is the state received any +2/3 votes in . While translating to this step, state machine votes for whether the block should be committed or not, and waiting for any +2/3 committing votes from other validators. If receives +2/3 commit votes with NIL, starts new round and moves step to .
, which is the state represents committing vote has been received from other validators. Block will be committed to the blockchain and consensus for this height is stopped. (responsibility of next height handling is at ).
In the above states, , If receiving proposal fails in , then step is moved to and vote NIL.
Similar to Propose, and also wait for or respectively, if +2/3 vote received but neither NIL nor Block is not +2/3. If still +2/3 vote is not received neither NIL nor Block after timeout runs out, then move to next step and vote NIL.
Validators are bonding/bonded nodes that participate in the consensus.
member.remarks: A represents a consensus of a single height and its multiple rounds.

summary.para: Adds or updates the dictionary with a key/value pair.

Internal logic is as follows:
If is found, update its value with .
Else, if the dictionary is not full, i.e. has not reached its limit in size, add and as a key/value pair.
Else, if the dictionary is full and replace option is set to , replace the oldest , i.e. , with .
Else, ignore.

The to use as a value.
member.returns: if the key/value pair was either added or updated, otherwise.

This returns only if all following conditions are met:
The dictionary does not contain as a key.
The dictionary is already full.
The replacement option is set to for this instance.
